title: 50-year-old stew
intro: Would you eat a stew that's been in a pot for 50 years? Beth and Phil discuss this and teach you some new vocabulary.
this_week_question: A restaurant in Bangkok has a stew that has been simmering for 50 years. What do you think is the main ingredient? Is it:
a) beef? b) chicken?, or, c) vegetables?
Listen to the programme to hear the answer.

vocab.desc: pot of stew into which new ingredients are regularly added so that the food is kept going and can be eaten over a long time
cooking at a temperature slightly below boiling so that the food bubbles gently
from the beginning, without the help of anything that has already been made
difficult to do; taking a lot of time and effort
